sentences.en: Be not immodest in urging your friends to discover a secret.
sentences.cn: 不要粗鲁地催促你的朋友揭露某个秘密.

sentences.en: Giving as unequals, we can easily develop an attitude of patronizing, immodest self - congratulation.
sentences.cn: 如果以不平等的态度给予, 我们就会很快摆出一副施惠与人的态度, 会变得不可一世.

sentences.en: He could become ungraciously immodest about his own capacities.
sentences.cn: 谈及自己的能力，他会自吹自擂大言不惭。

sentences.en: Immodest claims in advertising and promotion.
sentences.cn: 广告和推销的不实宣传.

sentences.en: Immodest words admit of no defense, for want of modesty is want of sense.
sentences.cn: 言谈傲慢,唯有一种解释:不够谦虚,来自缺乏见识.

sentences.en: It was not, however, what would have been called an immodest glance.
sentences.cn: 不过, 这又不是通常说的那种轻佻的目光.

sentences.en: Many old people find the bikini immodest.
sentences.cn: 许多老年人感到穿比基尼式游泳服不正派.

sentences.en: Webb was an immodest publicist of his own achievements.
sentences.cn: 韦布宣扬起自己的成绩来毫不谦虚。

sentences.en: Whistler was not just immodest , he was shamelessly vain.
sentences.cn: 惠斯勒并不只是粗野无礼, 而是自负无耻.

words.tran_cn: 不客气地；不谦虚地；放肆地

trans.tran_cn: 不谦虚的，自负的，不正派的，下流的
trans.tran_en: having a very high opinion of yourself and your abilities, and not embarrassed about telling people how clever you are
